GamePlay
Class Spawner

java.lang.Object
  GamePlay.Spawner
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Spawner
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Class used to populate the game grid with bot static and dynamic objects used during the gameplay state of the game.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Summary
Spawner(StageData stageData)
          Initializes a spawner object used to populate the game grid when starting a new game, and advancing stages.

Constructor Detail

Spawner

public Spawner(StageData stageData)
Initializes a spawner object used to populate the game grid when starting a new game, and advancing stages.

Parameters:
stageData - Object specifying the types of enemies present on the current stage and whether the current stage is a bonus stage or not.
Method Detail

generateWalls

public GameObject[][] generateWalls()
Returns:
Returns the gridLayout with brick and concrete walls generated.

generateConcreteWalls

public void generateConcreteWalls()
Populates the grid with the constant and fixed concrete walls that surround the edges of the map and interleave some of the rows.

generateBrickWalls

public void generateBrickWalls()
Populates the game grid with brick walls. Walls are generated with a 20% chance on tiles that are not occupied by concrete walls.

generateEnemies

public java.util.ArrayList<Enemy> generateEnemies()
Generates the set of enemies present on the game grid at valid locations previously determined during brick wall generation.

Returns:
ArrayList containing the enemy objects that are present on the grid following the specifications of the current stage.

createSetOfHarderEnemies

public java.util.ArrayList<Enemy> createSetOfHarderEnemies(EnemyType harderEnemyType,
                                                           int posX,
                                                           int posY)
Creates a set of harder enemies to be spawned on the grid. This methods gets called when flames collide with a PowerUp or Door.

Parameters:
harderEnemyType - The enemy type that will be used to generate the harder set of enemies.
posX - Integer specifying the x coordinate where the enemies should be located (Position of the door or powerUp)
posY - Integer specifying the y coordinate where the enemies should be located (Position of the door or powerUp)
Returns:
An ArrayList containing the harder set of enemies.

createSetOfHardEnemiesAtRandomPositions

public java.util.ArrayList<Enemy> createSetOfHardEnemiesAtRandomPositions(EnemyType harderEnemyType)
Creates a set of harder enemies at random valid locations on the game grid. This method gets called once the 200 second timer runs out in a non-bonus stage.

Parameters:
harderEnemyType - The enemy type that will be used to generate the harder set of enemies.
Returns:
Returns an ArrayList containing the harder enemies.

createBonusStageEnemy

public Enemy createBonusStageEnemy()
Used to generate a new enemy of the unique type present in a bonus stage. We generate a new enemy every second during a bonus stage.

Returns:
A new enemy object to be placed on the grid.

generatePowerUp

public PowerUp generatePowerUp()
Spawns the powerUp present on the stage based on the requirements given by the StageData object.

Returns:
Returns the powerUp object present on the grid.

generateDoor

public Door generateDoor()
Spawns the door object that allows the object to advance to the next stage in a non-bonus stage.

Returns:
Returns the door object present on the grid.

nextStage

public void nextStage(StageData stageData)
Load the StageData specifications for the next stage.

Parameters:
stageData - Object specifying the types of enemies present on the current stage and whether the current stage is a bonus stage or not.

getRandomCoordinateFromSet

public Coordinate getRandomCoordinateFromSet(java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> coordinates)
Retrieves a random coordinate from the passed ArrayList. Used to determine the spawn locations of new enemies on the grid.

Parameters:
coordinates -
Returns:
Returns random coordinates from ArrayList.

clearPossibleCoordinates

public void clearPossibleCoordinates()
Clears the structures containing possible spawn locations for enemies, powerUps and doors.

isNotInSpawnArea

public boolean isNotInSpawnArea(int row,
                                int col)
Determines whether the selected location to spawn a brick wall is in the three tile area where the player spawns after dying. No brick walls should appear at this location.

Parameters:
row - Integer specifying the row selected to spawn a brick wall.
col - Integer specifying the col selected to spawn a brick wall.
Returns:
Returns true if the passed coordinate is not in the area where the player spawns.

getRandomBoolean

public boolean getRandomBoolean()
Returns a true boolean with a 20% chance.

Returns:
A randomly generated boolean with a 20% chance of being true.

getGridLayout

public GameObject[][] getGridLayout()
Retrieve the two dimensional array encoding where the walls are present on the grid.

Returns:
A two dimensional array specifying the location of walls on the grid.

getPossibleEnemyCoordinates

public java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> getPossibleEnemyCoordinates()
Retrieve the possible enemy spawn locations.

Returns:
An ArrayList containing the possible spawn locations of enemies on the grid.

getPossiblePowerUpAndDoorCoordinates

public java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> getPossiblePowerUpAndDoorCoordinates()
Retrieve the possible powerUp and Door spawn locations.

Returns:
An ArrayList containing the possible spawn locations for the powerUp and Door objects.
